article.headline: CS-Northridge 57, UC Riverside 43
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Thomas Shewmake had a game-high 14 points and 11 rebounds as Cal State Northridge beat UC Riverside 57-43 Thursday night. In a game marked by poor shooting at both ends, Northridge led from wire-to-wire, taking a 31-16 lead into the break and never allowing its lead get any smaller than seven points in the second half. The Matadors shot 37.7 percent (20-for-53) to Riverside's 29.5 (13 of 44). Riverside twice got to within seven after the break, first when Vili Morton's free-throw with 12:54 left capped an 8-0 run that was that made it 37-30. Cal State Northridge (3-7, 1-1 Big West Conference), which opened the second half by making just two of its first eight shots, answered with a 6-0 run to stretch its lead back to double-digits. Later the Matadors went on an 11-2 run that made it 56-40 with 3:31 remaining. The Matadors made four consecutive baskets during that stretch, and Ian Boylan scored six of his 11 points during the run. Rickey Porter led UC Riverside (4-6, 0-2), which has lost all five of its road games this season, with 13 points. Davin White added in 10 for Northridge. In the first half, Northridge opened with a 7-0 run and later went on a 12-2 spurt to take a 24-11 lead with 4:15 left. The Matadors went into halftime with a 31-16 lead.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
